flc.nbl_actors.core

Class GreenThr_single

  • java.lang.Object
    • flc.nbl_actors.core.GreenThr_single
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGreenThr, IGreenThrFactory, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.util.concurrent.Executor

    public class GreenThr_single
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGreenThr, IGreenThrFactory
    Green-thread backed by a single real java Thread. Date: 18.07.13

        Schedule a runnable message. All messages are executed sequentially; at most one Runnable are processed at any time.

        (Implementations should call ThreadContext.get().beforeRun() before running.)

      • setActiveListener

        public void setActiveListener(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Boolean> listener)
        Description copied from interface: IGreenThrFactory
        Set active listener; called when active status changes (with 'true' if at least one thread is active, ie. has more messages). Callback sequence: 
         1: First called immediately with current state (in callers thread).
 2: Then once when state changes.
 3: Then discarded, unless the listener is an instance of ListenerSet.IKeep,
    which makes it trigger repeatedly.
        NB; The listener may be called from any thread of this factory, so if it accesses mutable fields, make sure it is tread-safe.
        Specified by:
        setActiveListener in interface IGreenThrFactory
        Parameters:
        listener - callback; called when active state changes

      • setMessageRelay

        public void setMessageRelay(IMessageRelay relay)
        Description copied from interface: IGreenThrFactory
        Set message relay. Intended to capture send/receive events for message tracing/debugging. Default implementation does nothing. Standard IGreenThrFactory.newThread() implementations should produce threads that calls IMessageRelay.intercept(Runnable, IGreenThr) from IGreenThr.execute(Runnable).
        Specified by:
        setMessageRelay in interface IGreenThrFactory
        Parameters:
        relay - relay

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: IGreenThrFactory

        Initiates an orderly shutdown in which previously submitted tasks are executed, but no new tasks will be accepted. Invocation has no additional effect if already shut down.

        This method does not wait for previously submitted tasks to complete execution. Use IGreenThrFactory.await(long) to do that.

        (Behaviour based on ExecutorService.shutdown())

        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface IGreenThrFactory

      • shutdownNow

        public void shutdownNow()
        Description copied from interface: IGreenThrFactory
        Attempts to stop all actively executing tasks, halts the processing of waiting tasks.

        This method does not wait for actively executing tasks to terminate. Use IGreenThrFactory.await(long) to do that.

        There are no guarantees beyond best-effort attempts to stop processing actively executing tasks. For example, typical implementations will cancel via Thread.interrupt(), so any task that fails to respond to interrupts may never terminate.

        (Behaviour based on ExecutorService.shutdownNow())

        Specified by:
        shutdownNow in interface IGreenThrFactory
